person.persName: James Russell Hallam (Kenton Co/Campbell Co Lawyer)

body.p: Newport, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Washington County, Pennsylvania native. Son of Charles Hallam and Rosanna Hagen Hallam. Married to Clarina M. Bailey Hallam on January 21, 1841 in Fayetteville, Tennessee. Married to Martha P. Robinson Hallam on January 6, 1863. Father of Henry C. Hallam, Theodore Hallam, James R. Hallam, Jr., Orrin Hallam, and Frank Hallam. Read law at Nashville in 1836. Admitted to the bar in 1842. Delegate from Grant County to the Whig Party Convention of Kentucky in 1852. Assistant elector for the presidential election of 1852 in Kentucky's tenth congressional district. Attorney in Newport, Kentucky in 1860. Sent to Camp Chase in 1862. Commonwealth's attorney pro tempore from c1864 to 1865 in the Kenton Circuit Court.
